alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Talbot; Taylor; Upson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 5:06AM EST until January 13 at 3:12AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River at US 19 near Carsonville affecting Upson, Talbot, Crawford and Taylor Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River near Griffin affecting Fayette and Spalding Counties. Line Creek near Senoia affecting Fayette, Spalding and Coweta Counties. For the Flint River Basin...including Americus, Peachtree City, Lovejoy, Fayetteville, Peachtree City, Woolsey, Sharpsburg, Peachtree City, Peachtree City, Senoia, Griffin, Orchard Hill, Griffin, Thomaston, Molena, Carsonville, Montezuma, Byromville... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Flint River at US 19 near Carsonville. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Minor flooding expands further into the woodlands and fields along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on U.S. Highway 19. The flood waters will be up to 6 feet deep over the top of the boat ramp and cover a portion of the access road by the bridge on the Taylor County side of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 19.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 AM EST Wednesday was 19.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 23.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.4 feet on 03/04/2001. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued at 300 PM EST.this afternoon at 515 PM EST.
